column4: how do i get a program to start when i log in?  i want to get tomboy notes to start automatically - minimized if possible
system > preferences > sessions
thanks, i'm trying that
that should save automagically
i know if you have advanced desktop settings it is possible for the most part
you can get that from add/remove programs if you dont have it already
hmm, i'm searching for it...
did you mean simple-ccsm?
up top you need to make sure you have it set to all available applications, then it is called Advanced Desktop Effects Settings (ccsm)
you mean make sure there's a check mark next to all the third party software repos?
on mine it is just a selection on the top that says All available applications
http://phubuntu.wordpress.com/2007/10/19/advanced-desktop-effects-settings/ seems to suggest the package is compizconfig-settings-manager
is that the package you're referring to?
yeah
after it is installed on mine it turns to the compiz name however in the Add/Remove programs list it was the advanced desktop settings name
which version of ubuntu do you have by the way?
8.10 currently but it has been that way fro me since 7.04 i believe
ah well thanks for the tip, switching the placement mode to cascade in compizconfig is a bit nicer
sorry i cant be of more help good luck
it's cool, cascaded windows is a bit of an improvement for not too much work
fair enough :)
